page.title: 02Eversley Crossing Patrol
page.content: {Mrs. Mills}was born in 1925 and has lived in{Kingsley Road}for 34 years. She has been our school lollipop lady for 31 years. She took the job because a little girl was knocked down and Mrs. Mills met a policeman who needed someone to guide the children safely across the road. She told us that she gets up every day at 5.00a.m. and goes to see her elderly neighbour. She arrives at school at 8.00a.m. and returns home at 9.00a.m. after making sure that the children are safely inside the school gate. She returns in the afternoon to make sure that the children are also on the school taxi safely. Our school is on a very busy corner. In l982{she was awarded the B.E.M. for long service. She now sees children into school whose parents came under her care years ago.
